file_content.text: Good luck finding Vik.
We caught part of a conversation between Vik and someone in his squad. Here.
--a dangerous mission, no doubt about it. To be honest, a lot of you probably won't make it back.
Of course, if you asked the guys up top, they'd never even admit to ordering this mission. That's how it is in this business.
But we're not here for glory or credits--we're here to save Balmorra. Am I right?
Why would Vik suddenly take off on a mission like this?
What is he up to?
Beats me. But he must have something to gain.
I don't know if I can even watch this nonsense.
This is ridiculous.
No, wait--listen to this part.
None of this tells me where Vik is, Prand.
I want coordinates, not chat.
Wait, wait--it's here.
Step one is Sobrik--once we have what we need there, it will be a straight shot to our final objective.
Sobrik's an Imperial-occupied city, one of their main bases of operations on Balmorra. Sounds like you could catch up to Vik there.
I'd better move out right away.
Understood.
Hopefully you can catch that scumbag before he slips away again.
Is there any way you can raise him on his holo?
Can we contact Vik directly?
No, he's smart enough to leave it off when he's not using it.
How am I supposed to search an entire enemy-occupied city?
I was expecting more details.
I know a guy, a major in the Republic Special Forces. Triam. He's been helping us out around Sobrik. I'll bet he could narrow down the search for you.
Thanks again for all your help. And good luck catching up to that scumbag.
You did it! Comms are back up, and we've already picked up a lot of Imperial chatter--you really made an impression.
I couldn't stand by while allies were in danger.
Happy to help.
We won't forget it; you can bet on that.
I've had much tougher ops.
Well, this was more than enough excitement for me. Good thing you were around.
Once the equipment came back up, Jalba had the bright idea of tapping Vik's communications like we do the Imps'. Listen to this.
Where's my missing explosives expert?
What about Vik?
I still need to find my explosives expert. Any ideas?
What about Vik?
That's the beautiful part. With the relays back online, we were able to tap into Vik's communications. Here's what we picked up.
We have to get those relays back online!
Scanning sector two... nothing. Just like the others, Prand.
Excuse me. I'm looking for Tanno Vik.
Ah! Oh, you're with the Republic. I thought I was dead meat.
Looking for Vik, huh? That Weequay scumbag is long gone.
It's imperative that I locate him immediately.
Do you know where he is?
Give me a sitrep. Why are you so worked up?
What's going on here?
We're worked up because we're completely defenseless!
Is Vik in trouble again?
What's he done?
Trouble? He's getting us all killed!
Vik was here earlier, but he slipped away when we weren't looking--along with our entire security team. All he left was this holorecording.
Gentlemen. Tanno Vik, Fifty-third Irregulars. I'm afraid your fine security team is being co-opted for a very important top secret mission.
This is all on Republic orders, of course, part of the big push--take a look at Regulation 235-R, you'll see that everything checks out. Have a good one.
How could you let one man take your entire security team?
Why didn't you stop him?
We were busy watching our stations! We never even saw them leave!
Vik is the least of our problems. With security gone, Imperial commandos have breached the perimeter and started sabotaging our equipment.
All of our comm relays are down. General Rakton himself could march an army through here, and we would have no way to warn anyone.
Is there any way to get the relays back online?
How can I help?
Who's General Rakton?
General Rakton?
Rakton's the Empire's top commander. He's planned and lead all of their major campaigns against us.
General Rakton is the Empire's top field commander. Supposedly, he's never been beaten.
General Rakton. Imperial infantry commander, overseer of forward assault operations and believed responsible for all major campaigns in Republic space.
Rakton is said to be the Empire's greatest marshal, guiding their warriors' many belligerent works against us.
Are you kidding? Rakton is the most famous Imperial general there is. They say he's never lost a battle.
None of this matters. Without those relays, the Imperials could invade at a moment's notice.
I'm here to find Vik, not deal with your comm relays.
Not my problem.
Aren't you listening? If the Imperials push through now, our forces would have no warning! We could lose everything!
Look, if you get those comm relays back online, I'll bet we could tap Vik's comms and find out where he's gone. Sound fair?
How do we fix the relays?
Sounds fair.
It's as good an option as any.
Sure, why not?
Yuun can find Vik without your help. Right, Yuun?
I have my own tracker.
The signs have lead us here most clearly, sir. Yuun believes the straightest path is that which Prand suggests.
Tell me how to fix the relays, Prand.
Fine, then.
Vik is going to regret this when I find him.
Why can't anything be easy?
All the more reason for us to help out.
Good to know my tracker is worthless.
Thanks for nothing, Yuun.
Yuun apologizes, sir. If any other path were clear, Yuun would happily suggest it.
If you can't find him, I won't be happy.
You'd better be right.
We'll find him. Trust me.
Judging by the way the relays cut out, I'd guess the Imps just yanked the power couplings.
Easy fix, but the problem will be fighting through those commando teams. Do you think you can manage it?
I'll have the relays back online in no time.
Affirmative.
Just like that, huh? Just another day on the job.
Are you kidding?
That's all the qualifications I need to hear.
If I don't help you, I'll never find Vik.
Do I have a choice?
That's about the gist of it.
We'll try to hold down the fort while you're gone. Good luck.
My assignment is to find Tanno Vik. Your relays aren't my problem.
This isn't my mission.
The only way we have to find Vik is to tap his comms like we do the Imperials'. For that, we need the relays.
It's your call. But if something doesn't happen soon, there won't be a chance left for any of us.
The Republic wouldn't tap a mercenary for a top secret operation.
That doesn't sound right.
Yeah. Didn't make much sense to us, either.
Have you looked up the regulation Vik mentioned?
Regulation 235-R?
We don't exactly keep a list of Republic regulations handy.
Yuun, do you recognize the regulation Vik mentioned?
Regulation 235-R?
Yuun apologizes, but this regulation is unfamiliar.
Jorgan, do you have any idea what he's talking about?
Regulation 235-R?
No, sir. Sounds like hot air to me.
Dorne? Are you familiar with Regulation 235-R?
Regulation 235-R?
Yes, sir, but it makes no sense. Regulation 235-R dictates the size and positioning of improvised field latrines.
Forex, do you have any record of that code?
Regulation 235-R?
That regulation doesn't match any that I've been programmed to consider, Captain.
We have to get those relays back online!
